intro: Copiapoa pseudocoquimbana var. domeykoensis, commonly known as the Domeyko's Copiapoa, is a species of cactus native to Chile. It is characterized by its columnar stem with ribbed structure and a dense covering of white to grayish spines. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy stems. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
